intro: Adenolobus pechuelii, commonly known as the Pechuel's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. The plant typically has simple, alternate leaves that are usually green and often have a waxy texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in a structure called a cyathium. Adenolobus pechuelii is native to certain regions of South America and is often found in dry, open habitats.
